meanings.definition: The quality or state of being trite or unoriginal.
meanings.sent1: Her writing lacked originality and was filled with tritenesses.
meanings.sent2: The speech was full of tritenesses that failed to captivate the audience.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's routine was so full of tritenesses that even the crickets stopped chirping.
meanings.sent4: The tritenesses in his artwork made it blend in with the rest, like a drop in the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The tritenesses in her excuses were as transparent as glass, fooling no one.

meanings.definition: A trite or unoriginal remark or idea.
meanings.sent1: His conversation was filled with tritenesses that bored everyone around him.
meanings.sent2: The book was full of tritenesses, making it predictable and uninspiring.
meanings.sent3: The tritenesses in his jokes were so overused that even the children didn't laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her tritenesses were like broken records, repeating the same old tune.
meanings.sent5: The tritenesses in his proposals were like echoes in an empty room, fading into nothingness.
